data.title: St. George Orthodox Church, Orlando
data.meta_description: St. George Orthodox Church in Orlando, USA - sight map, attraction information, photo and list of walking tours containing this attraction. Get offline map and directions using our GPSmyCity self-guided walking tours app for your mobile device.
data.text:
Saint George Antiochian Orthodox Church, located in Orlando, is a remarkable religious site with a rich history. Initially, this building served as the First Church of Christ, Scientist. It was constructed in 1927, showcasing a design that reflects the architectural styles of the period. This historical significance was recognized when it was added to the National Register of Historic Places on June 3, 1980.

The transition of the building from the First Church of Christ, Scientist to the Saint George Orthodox Church represents a continuity of religious and community service. The original Church of Christ, Scientist congregation has since relocated to 915 North Ferncreek for their services.

Saint George Orthodox Church is prominently situated across from Lake Eola in the heart of downtown Orlando. This location underscores its importance as a religious and cultural landmark in the area. The church is particularly noted for its stunning architectural design, which includes classic columns that contribute to its iconic status in the downtown landscape.

A significant feature of the church is its Eastern Altar, a centerpiece used for weekly Vespers and Orthros Services. This altar, along with the churchâ€™s overall ambiance, offers a serene and spiritual environment for worship.

Furthermore, Saint George Orthodox Church is known for its welcoming nature. It invites members from all Orthodox Christian backgrounds, reflecting a spirit of inclusivity and unity within the diverse Orthodox community. This welcoming stance has helped the church to establish itself as a vital religious institution in Orlando, fostering a sense of community and spiritual growth among its congregation.

Orlando Downtown Walking Tour

Orlando, Florida, the county seat of Orange County, is also known affectionately as the "Sunshine State's Crown Jewel".

The history of Orlando dates back to the mid-19th century when the area was inhabited by Native American tribes. In 1838, during the Second Seminole War, the US Army built Fort Gatlin in the vicinity. The settlement around the fort eventually grew, and in 1857,... view more

Tour Duration: 1 Hour(s)

Travel Distance: 2.1 Km or 1.3 Miles
